drafts.recipient: David Chang, CTO at Apex Technologies
drafts.subject: Quick question about your data orchestration stack
drafts.body:
Hi David,

I noticed Apex just expanded into the healthcare vertical — congrats on the Cedars-Sinai win. We've been helping similar companies automate their data pipelines and cut engineering overhead by 40%.

Would you be open to a 15-min call next week? I'd love to share what we've learned working with companies at your scale.

Best,
Alex
drafts.context: Met at TechCrunch Disrupt. Expressed interest in automation tooling. Healthcare expansion creates data compliance needs we solve.

drafts.recipient: Jennifer Wu, VP Product at Cascade Inc
drafts.subject: Loved your talk on product-led growth
drafts.body:
Hi Jennifer,

Your PLG talk at SaaStr was fantastic — especially the bit about activation metrics. We're applying similar principles at Acme and seeing great results.

I'd love to exchange notes. We recently crossed 500 self-serve signups/month and I think there's an interesting collaboration opportunity around our platforms.

Coffee or Zoom next week?

Best,
Alex
drafts.context: Strategic partnership target. Cascade's user base overlaps with our ICP. Potential integration partnership.

drafts.recipient: Robert Kim, Managing Director at Pacific Ventures
drafts.subject: AI-powered operations for portfolio companies
drafts.body:
Hi Robert,

I'm Alex, CEO of Acme Ventures. We build AI agents that automate executive operations — from email triage to competitive intel to meeting prep.

I understand Pacific Ventures has 40+ portfolio companies. We're seeing strong traction with venture-backed companies who want to move faster with leaner teams.

Would it be valuable to explore a portfolio-wide partnership?

Best,
Alex
drafts.context: Warm intro via Sequoia connection. Pacific Ventures portfolio would be 40+ potential customers.
